lines.text:
[after he older Brandon has verbalized his dream of a trancontinental railroad]
Poor dreamer - he's chasing a rainbow.
Yes, Tom - and some day men like you will be laying rails along that rainbow.

[Before narrative begins]
Accurate and faithful in every particular of fact and atmosphere is this pictorial history of the building of the first American transcontinental railroad.

[about the older Brandon]
He feels the momentum of a great nation pushing westward - he sees the inevitable.
Boys, this bar of justice and likker will still function when we get to Cheyenne - Let 'er go!

[to Miriam]
When they drive the golden spike, we'll belong to both sides - and to each other.

[Referring to Brandon]
With his own hands he has driven the last spike - the buckle in the girdle of a continent.

[to Brandon]
Put your pride in your pocket, me lad! Tell the sweet, young lady the truth.

[referring to Brandon]
The roar of his father's dream - 'his' dream - for he too is helping to build it.

[as Jesson and Brandon are about to have a showdown in the saloon]
This town's a law an' order town - an' this fight's goin' to be conducted legal!
